definitions: person who takes over a role, position, or title from someone else
thing that follows or comes after another in sequence
examples: The board appointed her successor before she retired completely
His successor inherited both the company's strengths and its challenges
The smartphone became the successor to traditional mobile phones entirely
Each software version improves upon its successor with new features

definitions: plant with thick fleshy leaves or stems adapted to store water
quality of being tender, juicy, and flavorful in food
examples: She arranged various succulents in decorative pots around her apartment
Desert succulents can survive months without any water or rain
The chef served succulent lamb chops with rosemary and garlic sauce
These peaches are particularly succulent when they're perfectly ripe

definitions: act of drawing something into the mouth using suction force
examples: The baby's suck reflex helps with breastfeeding from birth onwards
Give the wound a quick suck to remove any venom immediately

definitions: person who is easily deceived or taken advantage of by others
organ or device that adheres to surfaces through vacuum pressure
shoot growing from the base or roots of a plant
hard candy on a stick that is sucked rather than chewed
examples: Don't be a sucker for those obvious internet scams online
He's such a sucker for romantic movies and always cries
The octopus uses suckers on its tentacles to grip surfaces
These rubber suckers help the bath mat stay in place
Remove the suckers from tomato plants to encourage fruit production
Rose suckers should be cut off at ground level completely
The children enjoyed colorful suckers at the carnival yesterday evening
She bought cherry-flavored suckers for the birthday party treats

definitions: continuous action of drawing in through vacuum or negative pressure
examples: The sucking sound from the drain indicated a blockage somewhere
Constant thumb sucking can affect children's teeth alignment over time

definitions: infant or young child who is still breastfeeding from mother
young mammal that has not yet been weaned from milk
examples: The suckling nestled contentedly against his mother's warm chest
Medieval paintings often depicted Mary with the suckling Jesus Christ
The farmer separated the sucklings from their mothers for weaning
A suckling pig is traditionally roasted whole for special occasions

definitions: force produced by creating a partial vacuum to draw objects together
medical or mechanical process of removing fluids using vacuum pressure
examples: The suction from the vacuum cleaner pulled up the carpet
These cups use suction to stick to smooth surfaces securely
The dentist used suction to remove saliva during the procedure
Liposuction involves suction to remove fat from specific body areas

definitions: logic-based number puzzle played on a nine by nine grid
examples: She completes the newspaper sudoku puzzle every morning with coffee
This sudoku app has puzzles ranging from easy to expert level

definitions: leather with a soft napped finish made from animal hide underside
examples: His suede jacket required special cleaning to maintain its texture
These suede shoes shouldn't be worn in wet weather conditions

definitions: hard fat around kidneys and loins of cattle and sheep used in cooking
examples: Traditional Christmas pudding contains suet for richness and moisture
Birds love suet feeders during cold winter months for energy

definitions: person who experiences pain, illness, hardship, or distressing condition
examples: Migraine sufferers often need to avoid certain trigger foods completely
The charity provides support for sufferers of rare genetic diseases

definitions: state of undergoing pain, distress, or hardship over a period
collective experience of pain or distress affecting groups of people
examples: Her suffering from arthritis increased during cold weather months significantly
The medication helped reduce his suffering after the surgery considerably
The war brought immense suffering to civilian populations across the region
Human suffering requires compassionate response from the global community collectively

definitions: state or quality of being enough or adequate for a particular purpose
examples: They questioned the sufficiency of evidence in the legal case
The sufficiency of food supplies became critical during the siege

definitions: letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to form a derivative
examples: The suffix '-ness' transforms adjectives into nouns like 'happiness' easily
Adding the suffix '-ly' to 'quick' creates the adverb 'quickly'

definitions: death or unconsciousness caused by being deprived of oxygen to breathe
examples: The cause of death was determined to be suffocation by smoke
Plastic bags pose a suffocation risk for young children at home

definitions: right to vote in political elections, especially as extended to previously disenfranchised groups
examples: Women's suffrage was achieved after decades of political activism worldwide
Universal suffrage ensures all adult citizens can participate in democracy

definitions: woman who campaigned for women's right to vote in early twentieth century
examples: The suffragette chained herself to railings in protest for equality
Many suffragettes were imprisoned for their civil disobedience actions repeatedly

definitions: person who advocates for extending voting rights, especially to women historically
examples: The suffragist organized peaceful demonstrations for voting rights reform nationwide
Male suffragists also supported the women's voting rights movement actively

definitions: sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugarcane and beets
informal term of endearment for someone dear or beloved
examples: She added two spoons of sugar to her morning coffee
The recipe calls for brown sugar instead of white sugar
Come here, sugar, and give your grandmother a big hug
The waitress called everyone sugar in her Southern drawl accent

definitions: tall tropical grass plant cultivated as the primary source of sugar production
examples: Workers harvested sugarcane in the fields under the hot sun
The sugarcane industry dominates the economy of several Caribbean islands

definitions: idea or plan put forward for consideration by others
slight trace or indication of something barely perceptible
examples: Her suggestion to reorganize the filing system improved efficiency greatly
The committee welcomed suggestions from all staff members equally
There was just a suggestion of garlic in the sauce
His smile carried a suggestion of sadness despite his cheerfulness

definitions: intentional act of causing one's own death through deliberate action
action that is destructive to one's own interests or causes
examples: Mental health services work to prevent suicide through crisis intervention support
The suicide rate decreased after implementing comprehensive prevention programs nationwide
Refusing that deal would be political suicide for his career
The company's decision to ignore customer feedback was commercial suicide

definitions: set of outer garments made of the same fabric and designed to be worn together
legal proceeding brought by one party against another in court
one of four categories of playing cards in a standard deck
formal petition or appeal made to a person in authority
examples: He wore his best suit to the job interview yesterday
The business suit has been standard office attire for decades
The company filed a suit against their former business partner
The lawsuit seeks damages for breach of contract and fraud
Hearts is the highest scoring suit in this card game
She collected all thirteen cards of the spade suit quickly
His suit for her hand in marriage was finally accepted
The diplomat presented their suit to the foreign ministry formally

definitions: quality of being right or appropriate for a particular person, purpose, or situation
examples: The committee assessed each candidate's suitability for the position carefully
They questioned the suitability of the venue for such a large event

definitions: portable rectangular case with a handle used for carrying clothes when traveling
examples: She packed her suitcase the night before the trip abroad
The airline lost his suitcase during the connecting flight transfer

definitions: set of rooms designated for one person's or family's use or for a particular purpose
set of instrumental compositions to be played in succession
set of matching furniture for a particular room
collection of programs or software with related functions
examples: They booked the honeymoon suite at the luxury resort hotel
The executive suite included a bedroom, living room, and office
The orchestra performed Bach's suite in D minor beautifully tonight
Each movement of the suite had its own distinct character
The dining room suite included table, chairs, and matching sideboard
They purchased a leather suite for their newly renovated lounge
The office suite includes word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software
This graphics suite contains all the tools needed for design work

definitions: woven fabric suitable for making suits and formal clothing
examples: The tailor showed various samples of wool suiting for winter
This lightweight suiting is perfect for summer business wear comfortably

definitions: man who pursues a relationship with a particular woman with marriage intent
company or person making a bid to take over or merge with another company
examples: In Victorian times, suitors would call on young ladies formally
She had several suitors but wasn't interested in marriage yet
The company rejected all suitors and remained independently owned completely
Several suitors emerged when the profitable business went up for sale

definitions: chemical compound of sulfur with another element or radical group
examples: Hydrogen sulfide produces the characteristic smell of rotten eggs naturally
Iron sulfide minerals are commonly found in sedimentary rock formations

definitions: yellow nonmetallic element that burns with blue flame and strong odor
examples: Sulfur deposits are found near volcanic regions around the world
The sulfur content in diesel fuel has been significantly reduced

definitions: salt or ester of sulfuric acid containing the SO4 group
examples: Copper sulphate solution appears bright blue in color when dissolved
Magnesium sulphate is commonly known as Epsom salts for bathing

definitions: compound of sulfur with another element or radical, British spelling variant
examples: Lead sulphide was used as a semiconductor in early crystal radios
Zinc sulphide glows when exposed to ultraviolet light or radiation

definitions: British spelling of sulfur, yellow combustible nonmetallic element
examples: Sulphur springs are believed to have therapeutic properties for skin
The sulphur mines operated continuously for over a hundred years

definitions: sovereign ruler of certain Muslim countries, especially of the former Ottoman Empire
examples: The sultan ruled the Ottoman Empire for over thirty years
The sultan's palace contained treasures from across the empire completely

definitions: light-colored seedless raisin made from white grapes
wife, mother, or daughter of a sultan in Muslim countries
examples: The fruit cake recipe calls for sultanas and mixed peel
Golden sultanas are sweeter than regular dark raisins generally
The sultana lived in the women's quarters of the palace
As sultana, she wielded considerable influence behind the scenes politically

definitions: territory or country ruled by a sultan as sovereign leader
examples: The Sultanate of Oman maintains traditional governance with modern development
Several sultanates existed across Southeast Asia before European colonization arrived

definitions: total amount resulting from addition of two or more numbers or amounts
particular amount of money
examples: The sum of all expenses exceeded our budget considerably this month
Calculate the sum of these numbers using the formula provided
They paid a substantial sum for the antique painting yesterday
The sum involved was more than anyone had expected initially

definitions: shrub or small tree with compound leaves and cone-shaped fruit clusters
tangy crimson spice made from dried and ground sumac berries
examples: Poison sumac causes severe skin reactions when touched directly outdoors
The sumac bushes turned brilliant red in the autumn months
Middle Eastern cuisine uses sumac to add tartness to dishes
Sprinkle sumac on hummus for extra flavor and color enhancement

definitions: brief statement or account giving the main points of something
immediate judgment or decision made without formal trial proceedings
examples: The executive summary highlighted the report's key findings and recommendations
Please provide a summary of the meeting for absent team members
The judge issued a summary judgment in favor of the plaintiff
Summary dismissal can occur for gross misconduct without notice period

definitions: process of adding things together or the total reached by adding
lawyer's final speech to the jury summarizing the case
examples: The summation of all votes took several hours to complete
This represents the summation of years of scientific research work
The defense attorney's summation lasted nearly two hours in court
Her powerful summation convinced the jury of reasonable doubt completely

definitions: warmest season of the year between spring and autumn
period of greatest activity, success, or happiness in life
examples: Summer temperatures regularly exceed ninety degrees in this region annually
The children spend their summer vacation at their grandparents' farm
She was in the summer of her life when illness struck
The artist's creative summer produced his most celebrated works ever

definitions: season or period of summer considered as a time for particular activities
examples: Summertime brings tourists flooding into our small coastal town annually
In summertime, the days are long and perfect for outdoor activities

definitions: highest point of a hill or mountain
meeting between heads of government to discuss important matters
examples: They reached the summit after six hours of difficult climbing
The summit offered breathtaking views of the surrounding mountain range
World leaders gathered for the climate summit in Paris annually
The peace summit resulted in a historic agreement between nations

definitions: act of ordering someone to appear or calling something into action
examples: The summoning of witnesses took longer than expected in court
His summoning of courage allowed him to face his fears

definitions: traditional Japanese form of heavyweight wrestling with ritual elements
examples: Sumo wrestlers follow strict training regimens and dietary requirements daily
The sumo tournament in Tokyo attracts thousands of spectators annually

definitions: pit or reservoir into which liquid drains, especially in basements or mines
examples: The sump pump prevents basement flooding during heavy rain storms
Oil collects in the engine sump at the bottom section

definitions: star at the center of our solar system that Earth orbits
light and warmth received from the sun's rays
examples: The sun rises in the east every morning without fail
Earth orbits the sun once every three hundred sixty-five days
She sat in the sun reading her book all afternoon
The plants need more sun to grow properly this season

definitions: ray or beam of sunlight shining through an opening
examples: Sunbeams streamed through the stained glass windows beautifully this morning
Dust particles danced in the sunbeam across the empty room

definitions: reddening and inflammation of skin caused by overexposure to ultraviolet rays
examples: Her severe sunburn required medical attention after the beach day
Always use sunscreen to prevent painful sunburn during outdoor activities

definitions: sudden appearance of bright sunlight through clouds
design or ornament resembling the sun with radiating lines
examples: A magnificent sunburst illuminated the valley after the storm passed
The sunburst broke through just as they reached the mountain top
The Art Deco mirror featured an elegant sunburst design pattern
She wore a vintage sunburst brooch on her jacket lapel
